div.p: No. 580/(c), La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

I feel honored, dear Mr Gibbs, with your kind invitation on behalf of the council of the Victorian Academy of arts, to witness the opening on Saturday,
The letter is dated on the basis of the report in the Argus, Monday 29 April 1878, p. 5: 'The eighth exhibition of the Victorian Academy of Arts was opened on Saturday afternoon by His Excellency the Governor. Sir George Bowen arrived shortly after 2 pm and was received by the president. There was no formal ceremonial of any kind…'. but I have to be from Friday til Monday on departmental engagements away from Melbourne
In M to G. Berry 26 April 1878, he announced that he was going to an unspecified place in the country until 29 April, but would continue to work there and maintain daily communication with his office. which arrangement prevents me to share in your festival.
Pray express to the Council my best gratitude for the consideration shown me.
